body.p:
Henderson Ky June 21st 1862
Gov B Magoffin Frankfort Ky
Dear Sir
There will be presented to you by many of the citizens of this county for the pardon of A J Hathway convicted and sentenced by the court here on a charge of grand larceny -- Now in the penitentiary

His wife and child are in destitution she appealed to me this morning to write to you in her behalf for the pardon of her husband My sympathies were exerted in her favor I had a conversation with Mr Kinery. He thinks he ought to be pardoned upon the merits of the case he being that he bought the cow from a black man. If the ends of Justice are subserved by his confinement so for such you can with . I should be glad you could restore him to his family

Judge Fowlers
Hathaways Case Henderson Co. Peny
